etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Francis Anstie (1833–1874), physician. From quasi- + periodic

definitions: Of a function: such that increasing the variable by a certain fixed amount multiplies the value of the function by a fixed function, or increases it additively by a fixed function.
Of a motion, oscillation, etc.: having two periods incommensurable in duration.
Of a pattern, crystal lattice, etc.: such that any element recurs elsewhere, but at irregular intervals.
